column4: Can someone give me a hand with using nvidia's X server: I'm trying to get dual monitors working
did you use the nvidia-settings?
I'm using the nvidia driver
am I understanding you?
still, did you use the nvidia program for settings?
no :)
no I have not to my understanding
there is a package that something like nvidia-settings, han gon a second I'll look it up
nvidia-settings is the name
install it and use it (with root I think)
I have that installed, only prob is that this is my first experience with linux
it's okay. But ou need to use that app
so I just go to command line and type "sudo nvidia-xconfig" ?
yes and then "sudo nvidia-settings"
Its pretty straight forward if you know what stuff means, and sadly I'm on my laptop now with a intel gfx, but my desktop has nvidia and dual monitors
I need twin view correct?
I don't really remember but either twin view or separate screens suits you best
thx for the help I have it working now :)
great! See it's not THAT scary with linux :)
I'm loving linux, how is open suse?
I have no idea, only used debian and ubuntu :)
